chunks.title: Paper Format Requirements
chunks.content: Any document submitted to the Court in paper format must be unfolded and produced on opaque 8Â½ x 11 inch white paper using a clear black image.

chunks.title: Caption Requirements
chunks.content: Every paper filed must contain a caption setting forth the name of the court, the title of the action, the file number, and the designation of the nature of the paper. A party's first filing must include their name and full residence address in the caption. If the party does not wish its full residence address to appear on the public docket, they may omit the address and simultaneously file under seal a notice containing its full address. Pro se parties must include telephone number.

requirements.court_name: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA

chunks.title: Case Number and Judge Initials
chunks.content: The case number of every paper must be followed by the initials of the judge to whom the case has been assigned. If the case is referred to a magistrate judge, the magistrate judge's initials must also be included.

chunks.title: Document Heading
chunks.content: Every document must contain a heading under the caption that describes the nature of the document.
examples: MEMORANDUM IN SUPPORT OF DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO DISMISS
PLAINTIFF'S OPPOSITION TO MOTION TO DISMISS
REPLY IN SUPPORT OF MOTION TO DISMISS

chunks.title: Exhibits and Attachments
chunks.content: All exhibits or attachments must include the number of the case in which they are filed.

chunks.title: Attorney Signature Requirements
chunks.content: Every paper signed by an attorney must contain their name, address, and telephone number. All attorneys listed on any document who are members of the D.C. Bar must include their D.C. Bar identification numbers, regardless of whether or not those attorneys sign the document.

requirements.dc_bar_members: must include DC Bar ID number
requirements.applies_to: all listed attorneys, not just signers

chunks.title: Nonconforming Papers
chunks.content: A document that does not comply with the formatting requirements of this rule and FRCP 10(a) will be identified by the clerk to be corrected by the end of the next business day. If it is not corrected, the clerk will forward to the assigned judge with a recommendation, if appropriate, that it be stricken for failure to comply.

consequences.failure_to_correct: forwarded to judge with recommendation to strike
